sprint_goal: Establish core infrastructure and implement the complete user authentication lifecycle (Register, Verify, Login, Logout).
epic_coverage: Identity & Access Management, Core Infrastructure & DevOps, User Profile & Network Management
key_deliverables: Provisioned AWS infrastructure (EKS, RDS, Redis), complete user registration/login/logout flow, secure JWT session management with blocklist, and foundational UI components for Profile.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate a user registering for an account, receiving a verification email, verifying the account, logging in, and logging out successfully. Show token invalidation after logout.
success_criteria: User can complete the entire authentication lifecycle. Core infrastructure is stable and accessible. All IAM E2E tests are passing in CI.
risk_factors: RISK-001: Delays in provisioning foundational cloud infrastructure. RISK-003: Transactional email deliverability issues.
mitigation_strategies: Frontend team to work against mocked APIs until infrastructure is ready. DevOps to prioritize SPF/DKIM/DMARC configuration for AWS SES.
external_dependencies: AWS API availability, DNS provider for SES configuration.
integration_windows: Integration of Frontend/Backend for IAM flow from Day 5.
burndown_target: Linear burndown with ~104 hours completed by day 5.

sprint_name: Sprint 2: Account Recovery, Profile & Connections MVP
sprint_goal: Enable account recovery via password reset and establish foundational profile (CRUD) and networking capabilities (send/accept requests).
epic_coverage: Identity & Access Management, User Profile & Network Management, Core Infrastructure & DevOps
key_deliverables: Full password reset flow, ability to create/edit/delete profile sections (Basic Info, Work Experience), ability to send and accept connection requests.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate a user requesting a password reset and successfully changing their password. Showcase adding and editing a work experience entry on a profile. Demonstrate User A sending a connection request to User B, and User B accepting it.
success_criteria: All key deliverables are demo-ready. E2E tests for profile and connection management are passing. All security requirements for authorization are met.
risk_factors: RISK-007: Flaw in authorization logic for profile editing. RISK-005: CI/CD pipeline flakiness slows down integration.
mitigation_strategies: Mandatory security code reviews for all authorization logic. DevOps to monitor and stabilize CI/CD pipeline performance.
burndown_target: Linear burndown with ~85 hours completed by day 5.
